text.section: In this section, "violence prevention program" means a course in which education and training is offered in the areas of recognizing, addressing, and resolving issues of violence in the home and the community.

The Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland has established at Bowie State University a State Center for Alternative Dispute Resolution and Violence Prevention. The Maryland General Assembly hereby recognizes that Center.

An individual or group operating a violence prevention program in the State shall be encouraged to submit to the Center:
A written description of the program; and
Any other information relating to the program required by the Center.

section.section: An individual or group may submit a request to the Center for information on any violence prevention program operating in the State or available to the State.
On request, the Center shall distribute information relating to a violence prevention program.

text.section:
The operation of the Center shall be supported by funds:
As provided by the Governor in the annual budget of Bowie State University; and
From any other source.
